[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/momentum.adaptor.move] [Function: sqrt_price_x64_to_price()] [Decimal Mismatch] When decimals_a > decimals_b, can price_u256_with_decimals * pow(10, decimals_a - decimals_b) overflow if the decimal difference is large (e.g., 18)? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/momentum.adaptor.move] [Function: sqrt_price_x64_to_price()] [Decimal Mismatch] When decimals_b > decimals_a, can price_u256_with_decimals / pow(10, decimals_b - decimals_a) round to zero for small prices, breaking position valuation? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/momentum.adaptor.move] [Function: sqrt_price_x64_to_price()] [Decimal Edge Case] Can decimals_a == decimals_b cause incorrect branching if the else clause should also apply special handling for equal decimals? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/momentum.adaptor.move] [Function: sqrt_price_x64_to_price()] [Decimal Validation] Are decimals_a and decimals_b validated to be within reasonable ranges (0-18), or can extreme values cause pow() to fail or overflow? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/momentum.adaptor.move] [Function: sqrt_price_x64_to_price()] [Zero Price] Can the function return zero price if all intermediate calculations round down, causing division by zero in calling functions? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/momentum.adaptor.move] [Function: get_position_token_amounts()] [Liquidity Math] Can liquidity_math::get_amounts_for_liquidity return (0, 0) for positions with liquidity > 0 due to rounding, causing incorrect zero-value positions? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/momentum.adaptor.move] [Function: get_position_token_amounts()] [Tick Math] Can tick_math::get_sqrt_price_at_tick revert or return incorrect values for extreme tick values (MIN_TICK or MAX_TICK), causing DoS? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/momentum.adaptor.move] [Function: get_position_token_amounts()] [Tick Ordering] Is there validation that tick_lower_index < tick_upper_index, or can reversed ticks cause incorrect amount calculations? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/momentum.adaptor.move] [Function: get_position_token_amounts()] [Position State] Can position.liquidity() return 0 for a valid position due to full withdrawal, causing (0, 0) amounts to pass validation incorrectly? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/momentum.adaptor.move] [Function: get_position_token_amounts()] [Pool State] Can pool.sqrt_price() be manipulated via pool operations to return incorrect current price, affecting amount calculations? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/momentum.adaptor.move] [Function: get_position_token_amounts()] [Rounding Direction] Does the false parameter in get_amounts_for_liquidity control rounding, and can this be exploited to consistently under/overvalue positions? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/momentum.adaptor.move] [Function: get_position_token_amounts()] [Amount Overflow] Can amount_a or amount_b overflow u64 for positions with very high liquidity, causing incorrect truncated values to be returned? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/momentum.adaptor.move] [Function: get_position_token_amounts()] [Cross-Pool Attack] Can an attacker pass a different pool reference than the one the position was created in, getting incorrect amounts? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/momentum.adaptor.move] [Function: get_position_value()] [Value Overflow] Can value_a + value_b overflow u256 for positions with extremely high token amounts and prices? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/momentum.adaptor.move] [Function: get_position_value()] [Value Calculation] Does vault_utils::mul_with_oracle_price correctly handle u64 to u256 conversion and maintain precision for all amount ranges? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/momentum.adaptor.move] [Function: get_position_value()] [Price Precision] Can normalized_price_a or normalized_price_b be zero due to rounding, causing one side of the position to be valued at zero? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/momentum.adaptor.move] [Function: get_position_value()] [Value Consistency] Are normalized_price_a and normalized_price_b denominated in the same base currency, or can currency mismatch cause incorrect value_a + value_b summation? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/momentum.adaptor.move] [Function: get_position_value()] [Casting Safety] Can casting amount_a and amount_b from u64 to u256 lose information or introduce errors? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/momentum.adaptor.move] [Function: get_position_value()] [Zero Value] Can both value_a and value_b legitimately be zero for an active position, and does this break downstream vault accounting? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/momentum.adaptor.move] [Function: update_momentum_position_value()] [Type Confusion] Can PrincipalCoinType mismatch with CoinA or CoinB, causing type confusion when retrieving the position from vault? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/momentum.adaptor.move] [Function: update_momentum_position_value()] [Type Validation] Can an attacker pass CoinA and CoinB in reversed order compared to the stored position, causing incorrect price calculations? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/momentum.adaptor.move] [Function: get_position_value()] [Type Name] Can into_string(get<CoinA>()) be manipulated or return unexpected values for non-standard coin types, breaking oracle lookups? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/momentum.adaptor.move] [Function: update_momentum_position_value()] [Asset Type] Can the asset_type String be crafted to match multiple positions or bypass vault_utils::parse_key validation? (High)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/momentum.adaptor.move] [Function: update_momentum_position_value()] [Generic Bounds] Are there missing trait bounds on CoinA/CoinB that allow incompatible types to be used with MomentumPool? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/sources/adaptors/momentum.adaptor.move] [Function: get_position_value()] [Type Casting] Can type_name_a or type_name_b strings fail to match OracleConfig entries due to type name formatting differences? (High)
